intro: Freesia grandiflora subsp. occulta, commonly known as the hidden freesia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms during the spring and summer seasons. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its unique subspecies status highlights its distinct botanical characteristics compared to other freesia varieties.
